pr_title: Migrate read arguments and downstream code to GATKPathSpecifier

timeline.bodyText: This mention of Paths being the preferred form is no longer true with this PR.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: The comment about Paths isn't accurate anymore.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: comment is out of date
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Ah, thanks for updating this.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't deal correctly with http path ending weirdness.  I think we should add a "getExtension" or 'getFilename" method to avoid making this mistake.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: A good improvement would be to add spark ReadInputArgument collections which only takes a single bam. Maybe we can do that in a separate pr.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Yes, but lets do that in a separate PR.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: maybe getHeaderForReadsInput would be better.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: If we're changing other stuff to single read inputs maybe we should just change the underlying map into a single field.  I think that plan had been to support multiple inputs later but we never got to it.
replies.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: All I did here was to change the signature of the method so that we don't have to hand out the map. Instead the caller just queries it. So I think this change is orthogonal to the number of inputs.
replies.author: cmnbroad

replies.bodyText: Changed the name to getHeaderForReadsInput.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: As mentioned above, lets add methods for these to GATKPathSpecifier
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: While we're here can we make OUTPUT_DIRECTORY a GATKPathSpecifier too and avoid going through File here.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: might have weirdness with http paths with cruft after them
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Can we lift the GATKPathSpecifier higher here and get rid of the string or is that difficult?
timeline.author: lbergelson

     /**
      * Same as GATKSparkTool's getRecommendedNumReducers(), but can specify input BAM path (for when --input is not used)
      */

replies.bodyText: It starts a cascade so it will be in a different pr.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Can these paths be input as Path specifiers instead of strings here?
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Yes, but it pulls on a longer thread. The pathseq package needs its own PR.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: looks like the same thread as above, I assume the todos mean we should hit them later instead of in this PR?  Should we open an issue?
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Replaced these with #6610 to track remaining todos.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Let's burn this whole class with fire.
timeline.author: lbergelson

      * @param path the path

      */

replies.bodyText: Yes, but still more work to do to get there.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: this needs a convenience method
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.message: Rebase and fix code to enable the merge build to compile on travis.

timeline.bodyText: There needs to be a comment about the different behavior on both methods javadoc. Otherwise people will accidentally interchange file.getExtension().equals(".fasta.gz") and file.hasExtension(".fasta.gz")
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: In order to use this safely there probably needs to be a matching hasExtension().  Otherwise people are forced to catch the exception in order to call this safely.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: I modified both getExtension and getBaseName to return "" if there is no extension or basename.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: This seems like the wrong error message.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Removed the throw and now returns "".
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText:
I think it might be better to be greedy about the extension and include everything after the first . as the extension? fasta.gz and bam.bai seem more common than "my.filename.has.random.dots.fasta".  Maybe I'm wrong about that though.
Typically when people call baseName it's because they want to create a similarly name file with a different extension, so stripping all the extensions makes sense.
I think the comment about the componentExisting but starting with "." doesn't match the tests where you have ".fasta.gz".baseName() == ".fasta".
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: We might want to prefer returning empty string when the base name/ extension are empty.   (not when they're missing because the file ends in "/" though...).
replies.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: Is this problematic with files that are at the root of the directory structure or with relative paths that don't include any path above the filename?
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: I don't think it is. The underlying URI always has a scheme with an (possibly empty) auth, and if the scheme is file, the path component is always an absolute path from the root, even if the input string was a relative path. There are tests for such cases, i.e., localFile.bam and /localFile.bam, so I think its ok.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Should we mark this as a todo when we get resolve methods on GATKPathSpecifier directly?
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Added to #6610.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this is inconsistent, but we should allow a basename to not have an extension.  localFile's base name is just "localFile" I think.
timeline.author: lbergelson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -286,6 +287,173 @@ public void testStdOut() throws IOException {
         }
     }
 
+    @DataProvider(name = "getExtensionTestCases")
+    public Object[][] getExtensionTestCases() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // input, extension
+                {"localFile.bam", ".bam"},
+                {"localFile.BAM", ".BAM"},
+                {"/localFile.bam", ".bam"},
+                {"gs://bucket/aFile.bam", ".bam"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/aFile.adam", ".adam"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/aFile.fasta", ".fasta"},
+                {"http://bucket/aFile.bam?query=param", ".bam"},
+
+                // getExtension() returns ".gz", but this case also satisfies hasExtension(".fasta.gz")
+                {"aFile.fasta.gz", ".gz"},
+                // basename is ".fasta"!
+                {".fasta.gz", ".gz"},
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = "getExtensionTestCases")
+    public void testGetExtension(final String spec, final String expectedExtension) {
+        final GATKPathSpecifier pathSpec = new GATKPathSpecifier(spec);
+        final String actualExtension = pathSpec.getExtension();
+
+        Assert.assertEquals(actualExtension, expectedExtension);
+        // verify that hasExtension(getExtension()) is always true
+        Assert.assertTrue(pathSpec.hasExtension(actualExtension));
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider(name="negativeGetExtensionTestCases")
+    public Object[][] negativeGetExtensionTestCases() {
+        return new Object[][]{
+                // no extensions
+                {""},
+                {"/"},
+                {"."},
+                {"localFile"},
+                {"localFile."},
+                {"/localFile."},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources?query=param"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/?query=param"},
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = "negativeGetExtensionTestCases", expectedExceptions={IllegalArgumentException.class})
+    public void testNegativeGetExtension(final String spec) {
+        new GATKPathSpecifier(spec).getExtension();
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider(name = "hasExtensionTestCases")
+    public Object[][] hasExtensionTestCases() {
+        return new Object[][]{
+                // input, extension satisfies "hasExtension"
+                {"localFile.bam", ".bam", true },
+                {"localFile.BAM", ".BAM", true },
+                {"localFile.BAM", ".bam", true },
+                {"localFile.bam", ".BAM", true },
+                {"/localFile.bam", ".bam", true },
+                {"gs://bucket/aFile.bam", ".bam", true },
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/aFile.adam", ".adam", true },
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/aFile.fasta", ".fasta", true },
+                {"http://bucket/aFile.bam?query=param", ".bam", true },
+
+                {"aFile.fasta.gz", ".gz", true },
+                {"aFile.fasta.gz", ".fasta.gz", true },
+                // basename is ".fasta"!
+                {".fasta.gz", ".gz", true },
+                {".fasta.gz", ".fasta.gz", true },
+
+                // no extensions
+                {"/", ".ext", false },
+                {".", ".ext", false },
+                {"localFile", ".a", false }, // extension must have length > 1
+                {"localFile.", ".a", false },
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources", ".fasta", false },
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources?query=param", ".fasta", false },
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/", ".fasta", false },
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/?query=param", ".fasta", false },
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = "hasExtensionTestCases")
+    public void testHasExtension(final String spec, final String extension, final boolean expectedResult) {
+        Assert.assertEquals(new GATKPathSpecifier(spec).hasExtension(extension), expectedResult);
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider(name = "getBaseNameTestCases")
+    public Object[][] getBaseNameTestCases() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // input, baseName
+                {"localFile.bam", "localFile"},
+                {"localFile.BAM", "localFile"},
+                {"/localFile.bam", "localFile"},
+                {"gs://bucket/aFile.bam", "aFile"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/aFile.adam", "aFile"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources/aFile.fasta", "aFile"},
+                {"http://bucket/aFile.bam?query=param", "aFile"},
+
+                // This case satisfies hasExtension(".fasta.gz"), but getExtension() returns ".gz".
+                {"aFile.fasta.gz", "aFile.fasta"},
+                // basename is ".fasta"!
+                {".fasta.gz", ".fasta",},
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = "getBaseNameTestCases")
+    public void testGetBaseName(final String spec, final String baseName) {
+        Assert.assertEquals(new GATKPathSpecifier(spec).getBaseName(), baseName);
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider(name="negativeGetBaseNameTestCases")
+    public Object[][] negativeGetBaseNameTestCases() {
+        return new Object[][]{
+                // no extensions
+                {"/"},
+                {"."},
+                {"/."},
+                {"/name/.fasta"},
+                {"localFile"},
+                {"gs://hellbender/test/resources"},

replies.bodyText: Makes sense. Done.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Could you add a test for the case ".".hasExtension(".") ?
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Hm, it doesn't. "." gets turned into a URI with an absolute path that ends in "/./".
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.bodyText: Should we simple tests for isSam, isBam, is Cram ?
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: We've come this far so, yes.
replies.author: cmnbroad

timeline.message: On second though, use Optional for extension/basename methods. Additional test cases.
Migrate reads command line arguments, and downstream code, to use GATKPathSpecifier - Phase 1.
Migrate read outputs and writers to GATKPathSpecifier.
Move read index inputs to GATKPathSpecifier.
Migrate UserExceptions with File type, and some tool output to GATKPathSpecifier.
Lift getReadPaths up to ReadArgumetnCollection, fix deprecation warning in GATKTool.
Remove TODOs in favor of an issue ticket.
Rebase and fix code to enable the merge build to compile on travis.
On second though, use Optional for extension/basename methods. Additional test cases.
Update changes in PathSeqBwaSpark from master.
Fix SplitReads to handle Optional returned from getBaseName and getExtension.
